intro: Stachytarpheta lacunosa var. attenuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or streambanks. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
